events.eventName: Join Us At Lone Mountain Park!
events.eventDescription: This is a group for parents of children who may be struggling with friendships. Our group is based on acceptance and tolerance. We will have get-togethers and play dates to enhance social skills, foster friendships for our children, and have fun! I have started this group because I have an energetic 8 year old, who often times feels left out by her peers due in part to her ADHD. If you have a child who may be feeling left out because of something they have little to no control over, join us! Let's help our children learn and grow together

events.groupDescription:
There are almost 6,000 children in the foster care system in Virginia. These children have been neglected and abused by those meant to love and care for them.

When they're taken out of these dire circumstances, they are placed in loving foster homes. Right now the need for homes is great.

Join us to learn more about becoming a foster parent and see how you can help a child in need of love.
events.eventName: Learn About Becomming A Foster Parent
events.eventDescription:
There are almost 6,000 children in the foster care system in Virginia. These children have been neglected and abused by those meant to love and care for them.

When they're taken out of these dire circumstances, they are placed in loving foster homes. Right now the need for homes is great.

Join us to learn more about becoming a foster parent and see how you can help a child in need of love.

events.eventName: Learn About Becomming A Foster Parent
events.summary: Informational gathering describing the programs in your area.
events.eventDescription:
There are almost 6,000 children in the foster care system in Virginia. These children have been neglected and abused by those meant to love and care for them.

When they're taken out of these dire circumstances, they are placed in loving foster homes. Right now the need for homes is great.

Join us to learn more about becoming a foster parent and see how you can help a child in need of love.

events.groupName: Fostering Peace, Love, Learning & Each Other
events.groupDescription: This group is about how together we can ALL foster a better world.   We are teachers, learners, parents and children (including--but NOT limited to--former, present and future foster parents and children), thinkers, doers, dreamers
events.eventDescription: I know you all have already done a million things to make the world a better place, or at least one or two, and we'd like to hear about it! Everyone will have 5-7 minutes to share their story. We will also share change we'd like to create in the future!

events.groupDescription: Parenting is rewarding, fun and the most amazing and important role we will play in our lives. But, it is also not easy. One way to think of it is, how we can best 'perfect the art of imperfect parenting.' I am an advocate of positive parenting that is rooted in a values-based and play-based approach.
events.eventName: Little Artists at Large! Art and Socialise Session
events.eventDescription: This 2-hr art exploration and social session is for toddlers aged 2 - 4 years of age. We'll start by some free play and introduction to each other with songs, and reading a story book. This is followed by the art session, where we will create art and end off with snacks, music and close.

events.groupDescription: We are a vital and active community of single parents. Our group provides a low pressure way to connect with other single parents on hikes, kids activities, dinners out, events with other single families and more. We average 5+ events per week.

This community was formed to create life-long bonds between children and parents who deeply involved in education of their children beyond the school set, including homeschooling, unschooling and home-based afterschool learning.

BGD mission is to redefine the perceptions of who Black Women are and what we are about by celebrating black women (us) in action. Thus doing activities that foster sister hood with in our community celebrating achievements and being active.

This group is for parents interested in participating in workshops and activities to learn and play with their preschoolers between the age of 2-6 years old. The workshops and activities will be centralized around simple Art & Craft or cooking activities that both the parent and the child can participate in. All these activities are meant for the bonding and fostering of stronger ties between the parent and child. More importantly, for the family to have great fun and learn together!

This group is for people who are currently, or who are considering, parenting  transracially. Open to all parents - single, couple, foster, same sex, etc.  The goal is to better understand the importance of race and cultural, and to share transracial parenting tips and resources.
events.eventName: Discussion: Ways we can help our children develop pride in their racial identity

events.groupDescription: Our primary purpose is to provide fun, stimulating events and socialization for our infants to preschool aged children while fostering support and friendships for moms and dads. Knowing that there are other parents going through the same trials and triumphs can make mothering a bit easier at times.
events.eventName: Walk and Play at Caper Acres

events.groupDescription: Veggie Kids is a unique organization/social group dedicated to supporting vegan and vegetarian families and is open to all who have an appreciation of an earth-friendly, eco-conscious lifestyle. This group promotes a healthy, organic, vegan lifestyle, but is open to EVERYONE regardless of their dietary choices.

In our ever changing, modern world, Spiritual Playdate helps Parents, Guardians and Mentors foster dialogue for their children through a global interfaith program enabling adults & organizations to explore & discover beliefs about the topic of god, through web-based educational tools designed to build bridges of acceptance & understanding.
events.eventName: Sharing Sacred Practices: An Experiential Interfaith Service
